definitions.text: the members of a business organization that owns or operates one or more establishments
examples: he worked for a brokerage house
Your muscles will firm when you exercise regularly

definitions.text: marked by firm determination or resolution; not shakable
not soft or yielding to pressure

examples: gave a strong pull on the rope

definitions.text: not subject to revision or change
(of especially a person's physical features) not shaking or trembling
examples: his voice was firm and confident

definitions.text: not liable to fluctuate or especially to fall

examples: holds a firm position as the country's leading poet

definitions.text: possessing the tone and resiliency of healthy tissue

examples: the post was still firm after being hit by the car

definitions.text: unwavering in devotion to friend or vow or cause; ; ; - Campaign song for William Henry Harrison
